results.title: Production of commercial gramophonic discs
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and P.J. Brook
results.brief_description: A look at the various processes involved in the making of a record - from the artists recording onto multi-track tapes, through to the marketing and distribution to the public. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Production control
results.brief_description: Dramatises the case for production control methods, showing the need and effect in a medium-sized firm. Co-ordinating and checking manufacturing processes and reliably assessing priorities makes it possible to avoid excessive delays and pressure of work.
results.description: Dramatises the case for production control methods, showing the need and effect in a medium-sized firm. Co-ordinating and checking manufacturing processes and reliably assessing priorities makes it possible to avoid excessive delays and pressure of work.

results.title: Production 5118
results.creator_credit: Wilding Picture Productions and Kirby Grant
results.brief_description: Dramatizes incidents to provoke discussion on problems of human communication. Unexpressed misunderstandings between Philip Baxter, a typical executor, and his personnel apply to many situations. After each episode, problems and skills in communication are discussed. In an allegorical sequence, Mr Baxter is judged by a signalman and a jury of his mates for failing to give and receive signals. A solution to the problem of communication is offered by the signalman.

results.title: Processing the census
results.brief_description: Shows how the details compiled of five million census forms are processed into useful and anonymous information by the Australian Bureau of Statistics during the population census which takes place every five years. No other credits available.

results.title: Processing files
results.brief_description: PM951;”Summary: Frank Lovis and Don Yeates look at the organisation of tape and disc files and consider updating methods. illustrate with the system in use for the childrens’ immunisation programme at Kingston-Upon-Hull”

results.brief_description: Explains the basic production of a newspaper from initial production to the finished product concentrating on the developing technology in the recording and printing of information.

results.title: Process control
results.brief_description: Explains how simple statistical methods may be used in the quality control of manufactured products. Illustrates how individual product measurements may be used to compile frequency distribution curves, average and range measurements. Explains how control charts, plotted from average and range figures, may be used to control the accuracy of a manufactured product.

results.title: Proboscis
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, Hugh Burton and Rebecca McLean
results.brief_description: Penny Gosonski and her family had an accident on their way to their holiday destination. Apart from her father’s death, the worst fate Penny had to face was the loneliness of being the sole heir to the family’s attribute. A large nose that could send a thousand balloons into flight. Cast includes Julia Fernandez, Bree-Anna Obst and Phillipa Hagen.
